description: Change of use from Guest House/Bed Sit (16 hostel rooms) to House in Multiple Occupancy (HMO) with a maximum of 7 units (1 person) (Sui Generis Use Class)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: HM/DV/1-3/2018/PL1; HM/DV/1-3/2018/PL3 (notwithstanding car parking and cycle parking details).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| Refuse and recycling storage as per approved plans (condition 2) shall be provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy S17 of the Draft London Plan 2017, policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016) and National Planning Policy Framework 2018 - section 2 Achieving Sustainable Development
| A minimum of seven cycle parking spaces shall be provided for the development hereby approved, prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 1.1 f of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy T5 Draft London Plan 2017, policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016),  ,the National Planning Policy Framework (2018) - section 9 Promoting Sustainable Transport and Ealing's Draft Transport Strategy 2018
| The maximum number of persons occupying the house in multiple occupation hereby approved shall be limited to 7 households as per approved plans (Condition 2).

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy; policy D2 Draft London Plan 2017, policy 7.4 of The London Plan (2016), National Planning Policy Framework (2018) - section 12 - Achieving well-design places.
